en: You must not come in contact with him.

en: He is my namesake, but no relation.

en: He and I are childhood friends.

en: He and I are teachers.

en: He and I are classmates.

en: He and I walked together.

en: His ideas conflict with mine.

en: I have nothing in common with him.

en: Who is younger, he or I?

en: Who is younger, him or me?

en: It is no use arguing with him.

en: I don't intend to marry him.

en: I would rather die than marry him.

en: It is vain to argue with him.

en: It is no use trying to argue with him.

en: I'm looking forward to seeing him.

en: I can't bear to work with him.

en: I'm going fishing with him.

en: Those whom he lived with respected him.

en: I used to go to school with him.

en: I had to choose going with him or staying here alone.

en: I don't want to be seen in his company.

en: I don't want to be seen with him.

en: I feel comfortable in his company.

en: I feel secure with him.

en: I disputed with him about world peace for an hour.

en: Unlike him, his son is tall.

en: If you disagree with him, he is liable to get angry.

en: Shake hands with him.

en: He is a childhood friend.

en: I once sat at the same table with him at a dinner party.

en: I am on good terms with him.

en: I'm on good terms with him.
zh: 我跟他关系挺不错的。

en: I just can't get along with him.

en: I met him for the first time.

en: He's just a business associate.

en: I am in touch with him.

en: He and I have been inseparable friends since our student days.

en: I haven't met him.

en: I want to talk frankly with him.

en: I often went fishing with him.

en: I have nothing to do with him.

en: I cannot get along with him.
zh: 我跟他合不来。

en: I can't get along with him.
zh: 我跟他处不到一块儿去。

en: Do you have access to him?

en: He and I have a near-telepathic understanding of each other. No sooner does one of us say something than the other is already responding.

en: I get on well with him.

en: I've been friends with him since we were children.

en: Don't get too close with him.

en: I have been on friendly terms with him for more than twenty years.

en: I have known him for ten years.

en: Don't disappoint him.

en: Do you want me to fix you up with him?

en: He and I have been good friends since we were children.

en: I benefited much from my association with him.

en: I am through with him.

en: I'll fix it up with him.

en: I am to meet him there.

en: He is the last person I would want to go skiing with.

en: I dream of seeing him there.

en: Not a day passes without having an argument with him.

en: I don't think I can get along with him.

en: It's very hard to get along with him.

en: He is very difficult to get along with.

en: There is no getting along with him.

en: I feel relaxed with him.

en: May I go with him?

en: I'd better see him.

en: When I understood him I thought better of him.

en: I am to meet him at ten.

en: If he can do it well, so much more can we.

en: He's supposed to be living in Nagano. What's he doing at Tokyo station?

en: He is a proud one, you see.

en: You really have to manage him carefully.

en: He is my type!

en: He is the only one that doesn't observe the custom.

en: Not only he but also I am to go.

en: His parents as well as he are very kind to me.

en: Only he read the letter.

en: His words pierced to the heart of the matter.

en: He is a genius, if ever there is one.

en: He is the very best baseball player in our school.

en: It occurred to me that he was the right man.

en: He is the very person I have wanted to see.

en: He is the very man I want.

en: He is the very man that we've been looking for.

en: He is the only person for the job.

en: He is the very best inventor in the class.

en: He may be the very man that I need.

en: He is the very man that I have waited for.

en: He is what we call a walking dictionary.

en: I wish I were as handsome as he.

en: If only I were as handsome as he is.

en: The loss of his sense of smell was due to a head injury.

en: His broken arm was the result of a slip on the ice.

en: Everybody suspected him of taking a bribe.

en: I asked him to stop talking, but he still went on.

en: Who is that gentleman to whom he is speaking?

en: Who is the gentleman he is speaking to?

en: When he finished speaking, there was a silence.

en: When he finished speaking, everyone was silent.

en: It was difficult for me to make out what he was saying.

en: Is he speaking English, French, or German?

en: The matter that he is talking about is important.

en: The girl to whom he is speaking is Nancy.

en: The girl he's speaking to is Nancy.

en: It's evident to everybody that he's in love.

en: It was only recently that he got well.

en: He cannot have gone against his parents.

en: He is acting for the chief director.

en: There is no denying that he is clever.

en: His disappointment was obvious to everyone.

en: It is on his father that he depends.

en: It is a pity that he can't come.

en: Is there any hope that he will come?

en: Let's wait till he comes.

en: Until he comes, I cannot go away.

en: I can't go until he comes.

en: Everything was in order until he came.

en: Be waiting here until he comes.

en: Please wait here until he comes.

en: I will wait here till he comes.

en: It is no good waiting for him to come.

en: It's no use waiting for him to come.

en: It is certain that he will come.

en: It makes no difference to me whether he comes or not.

en: He will blow our party.

en: The news that he would come, quickly got abroad.

en: That he will come is certain.

en: There's no possibility of his coming.

en: I think it possible that he may come.

en: I think it's possible that he may come.

en: It makes no difference whether he comes or not.

en: I am doubtful whether he will come.

en: I don't know whether he will come or not.

en: I doubt if he will come.
zh: 我看他不一定会来。

en: I thought it doubtful whether he would come or not.
zh: 我当时就觉得他够呛能来。

en: It isn't certain whether he will come or not.
zh: 他来不来还不一定呢。

en: It makes no difference whether he will come or not.
zh: 他来不来都一样。

en: It doesn't matter whether he comes or not.
zh: 他来不来没关系。

en: I don't know whether he comes or not.
zh: 我不知道他来不来。

en: I don't know whether he'll come or not.
zh: 我不知道他会不会来。

en: It is uncertain whether he is coming or not.
zh: 他来不来还不确定。

en: It is doubtful whether he will come or not.
zh: 谁知道他到底来不来啊。

en: It matters little whether he comes or not.
zh: 他来不来其实不重要。

en: Whether he comes or not, the result will be the same.
zh: 不管他来不来，结果都一样。

en: Whether he comes or not, I'll go.

en: If he doesn't come, we won't go.

en: It was extraordinary that he did not come.

en: Seeing that he has not come, he may be on a trip.
zh: 既然他还没来，可能是去旅游了。

en: I bet five dollars that he will not come.

en: Whether he comes or not, we'll begin the party on time.

en: I expected that he would come.

en: Ask him about it when he comes.

en: We will start when he comes.

en: Will you let me know when he comes?

en: Let's do it when he comes.

en: I'll tell him so when he comes.

en: Let me know in no time when he comes.

en: Let's start as soon as he comes.

en: We will leave as soon as he comes.

en: I'll give him your message when he comes.
zh: 等他来了我会转告他的。

en: When he came, I was doing my homework.
zh: 他来的时候我正在写作业。

en: I had written the letter when he came.
zh: 他来的时候我已经写好信了。

en: I was taking a bath when he came.

en: It is not so much money as fame that he wanted.

en: The reason which he gave is hard to understand.
zh: 他给的理由挺让人费解的。

en: I see that he is an able man.

en: I can see how you'd call him a famous personality.

en: I understand that he's something of a famous personality.

en: I know him for a man of ability.

en: The fact remains that he is guilty.
zh: 事实就是他确实有罪。

en: It cannot be denied that he is guilty.
zh: 不可否认，他确实有罪。

en: They say he is guilty, but I believe the contrary.

en: It never occurred to me that he might fail his friend.

en: We know him to be a brave man.

en: I could not but admire his courage.

en: He is likely to win the championship.

en: He is famous as a good doctor.

en: What do you think made him break his promise?

en: It wasn't easy for him to keep his promise.

en: It goes without saying that he keeps his promise.

en: It is doubtful whether he will keep his word.

en: I want to meet him to see whether or not he gives me useful information.
zh: 我想见见他，看他能不能给我点有用的消息。

en: Let's wait till he comes back.
zh: 咱们等他回来吧。

en: It makes no difference to me whether he likes baseball or football.
zh: 他喜欢棒球还是足球，对我来说都没差。

en: I will wait here until he comes back.
zh: 我会在这儿一直等到他回来。

en: We have to stay a decision until he comes back.
zh: 咱们得等他回来再做决定。

en: I will finish it by the time he comes back.
zh: 等他回来的时候我就能做完了。

en: Whatever will become of his wife if he does not return?
zh: 要是他不回来，他老婆可怎么办啊？

en: There was nothing for it but to wait till he came back.
zh: 没办法，只能等他回来了。

en: Wait here till he comes back.
zh: 在这儿等他回来。

en: Please wait till he comes back.
zh: 请等他回来。

en: How about waiting here until he gets back?
zh: 要不咱们在这儿等他回来？

en: The hope of his return encouraged me.
zh: 他能回来的希望鼓舞了我。

en: When he came back, the woman had walked off.
zh: 等他回来的时候，那个女人已经走了。

en: I will tell him so when he comes back.
zh: 等他回来我会这么告诉他的。

en: Give him the message when he comes back.
zh: 等他回来把话带给他。

en: Tell him so, when he comes back.
zh: 等他回来了就这么告诉他。

en: As soon as he returns, I will tell you.
zh: 他一回来我就告诉你。

en: When he awoke it was day.
zh: 他醒来的时候天已经亮了。

en: Let's wait until he wakes up.
zh: 咱们等他醒了吧。

en: We didn't move so that we would not wake him up.
zh: 我们没敢动，怕吵醒他。

en: I felt myself insulted when he kept silence.
zh: 他一直不吭声，我觉得受到了侮辱。

en: Do you think his silence denotes guilt?
zh: 你觉得他不说话是心虚吗？

en: She inferred from his silence that he was angry.
zh: 她从他的沉默里看出来他生气了。

en: I saw him sawing a tree.
zh: 我看到他在锯树。

en: I wonder whether he'll make it here on time tomorrow. Want to bet a can of juice on it?
zh: 我在想他明天能不能按时到。要不要赌一罐果汁？

en: It is preferable that he gets there by tomorrow.
zh: 他最好明天能赶到那儿。

en: He may well be proud of his daughter.
zh: 他完全有理由为女儿感到骄傲。

en: If he is innocent, it follows that his wife is guilty.
zh: 如果他是清白的，那就说明是他老婆干的。

en: No one believes that he is innocent.
zh: 没人相信他是清白的。

en: It was evident to all of us that he was innocent.
zh: 我们大家都看得出来他是清白的。

en: That he is innocent is quite certain.
zh: 他肯定是清白的。

en: There is no hope of his coming back safe.
zh: 看来他是没法平安回来了。

en: I'm anxious for him to return safe.
zh: 我很担心他，希望他能平安回来。

en: The news of his safe arrival delighted his family.
zh: 听到他平安到达的消息，家里人都高兴坏了。

en: His family was glad to hear that he had arrived safely.
zh: 听说他平安到了，家里人都很高兴。

en: Make certain that he returned home safely.
zh: 确认下他是不是平安到家了。

en: They rejoiced when they heard he was safe.
zh: 听说他平安无事，他们都高兴坏了。

en: I was relieved to hear that he was safe.
zh: 听说他平安无事，我就放心了。

en: We have every reason to believe him innocent.
zh: 我们有充分的理由相信他是清白的。

en: It goes without saying that he is not guilty.
zh: 他当然没罪，这还用说吗。

en: We are not alone in believing that he is not guilty.
zh: 觉得他没罪的不止我们几个。

en: He was about to fall asleep, when he heard his name called.
zh: 他正要睡着呢，突然听到有人叫他的名字。

en: A burglar broke in while he was asleep.
zh: 他睡觉的时候，家里进小偷了。

en: His perfect score brought the class average up.
zh: 他的满分拉高了全班的平均分。

en: It is true that he goes abroad every year.
zh: 他确实每年都出国。

en: He writes a daily journal, and that inspired me to try doing the same thing, but in English.
zh: 他每天记日记，这启发我也想尝试用英文写日记。

en: I can't figure out what he really wants.
zh: 我搞不懂他到底想要什么。

en: It's no good his trying to find the true reason.
zh: 他去找真相也没什么用。

en: It's no use for him to try to find out the real reason.
zh: 他去查真正的理由也是白费力气。

en: It is doubtful whether he is telling the truth.
zh: 我很怀疑他是不是在说实话。

en: His failure to tell me the truth caused an accident.
zh: 因为他没跟我说实话，结果出事了。

en: You can count on him to tell the truth.
zh: 你可以相信他，他会说实话的。

en: I could read between the lines that he wanted me to resign.
zh: 我能听出他的话外之音，他是想让我辞职。

en: He put the idea into my head.
zh: 这主意是他给我出的。

en: All he wanted was time to finish his painting.
zh: 他只是想要点时间把画画完。

en: There is no need to take his advice if you don't want to.
zh: 你要是觉得不想听，就不必听他的建议。

en: That he was busy is true.
zh: 他当时确实很忙。

en: I know that he was busy.
zh: 我知道他当时挺忙的。

en: It is impossible that he is busy.
zh: 他不可能在忙。

en: I know he is busy.
zh: 我知道他很忙。

en: I ran after him with a pile of papers that he'd left behind.
zh: 他落下了一堆文件，我赶紧追上去还给他。

en: It is three years since he died.
zh: 他已经去世三年了。

en: It's been three years since he died.
zh: 他都走了三年了。

en: They say that he has been dead for two years.
zh: 听说他已经去世两年了。

en: His death was partly my fault.
zh: 他的死我也有一部分责任。

en: We had known him for five years when he died.
zh: 他去世的时候，我们已经认识五年了。

en: I had just finished my homework when he visited me.
zh: 他来找我的时候，我刚写完作业。

en: She was all eyes as he opened the jewelry box.
zh: 他打开首饰盒时，她的眼睛都直了。

en: As he was studying, the door was suddenly flung open.
zh: 他正学习呢，门突然被猛地推开了。

en: No wonder he didn't feel like studying.
zh: 难怪他不想学习。

en: I didn't know he had decided to leave.
zh: 我不知道他已经决定要走了。

en: He painted the picture which is on the wall.
zh: 墙上那幅画是他画的。

en: In the years he had worked so hard for equality, new laws had been passed.
zh: 在他为平等辛勤工作的那些年里，通过了一些新的法律。

en: We had a hard time doing the job because he was always complaining.
zh: 因为他一直在抱怨，我们那活儿干得很辛苦。

en: Seeing that he is angry, there must be some misunderstanding.
zh: 看他这么生气，肯定是有什么误会。

en: I heard him go out of the room.
zh: 我听见他走出房间了。

en: He had no sooner gone out of the room than all of them burst out laughing.
zh: 他刚一出房间，大家就都哄堂大笑。

en: I noticed him sneak into the room.
zh: 我注意到他偷偷溜进房间了。

en: Hardly had he entered the room, when she burst into tears.
zh: 他刚一进屋，她就哭了出来。

en: I saw him enter the room.
zh: 我看见他进屋了。

en: He entered the room, to be confronted by a policeman.
zh: 他一进屋，正碰上个警察。

en: It is an open secret that he deals in weapons.
zh: 他倒卖军火是公开的秘密。

en: The news that he had got injured was a shock to her.
zh: 他受伤的消息让她大受打击。

en: His face says that he lost.
zh: 看他的脸色就知道他输了。

en: He may well be proud of his father.
zh: 他以他父亲为荣也是理所当然的。

en: He will succeed to his father's property.
zh: 他会继承他父亲的财产。

en: He is managing the business for his father.
zh: 他在帮他父亲打理生意。

en: He complains with good reason.
zh: 他抱怨得有道理。

en: His rudeness was conscious, not accidental.
zh: 他的无礼是故意的，不是偶然的。

en: To my surprise, he failed in the exam.
zh: 让我惊讶的是，他考试竟然没及格。

en: She despises him only because he is poor.
zh: 她瞧不起他，仅仅因为他穷。

en: Just because he is poor, it does not follow that he is unhappy.
zh: 不能因为他穷，就觉得他不快乐。

en: He fell ill three years ago.
zh: 他三年前病倒了。

en: It was the bad weather that caused his illness.
zh: 是糟糕的天气让他生病的。

en: You ought to have known that he was sick in bed.
zh: 你早该知道他卧病在床了。

en: It never occurred to me that he might be ill.
zh: 我压根儿没想到他会生病。

en: He can't be ill.
zh: 他不可能生病。

en: It is true that he is ill.
zh: 他的确是病了。

en: The fact that he was sick was not very impressive to her.
zh: 他生病这件事并没有让她太在意。

en: It seems obvious that he is sick.
zh: 显而易见，他病了。

en: Can it be true that he is ill?
zh: 他真的病了吗？

en: Let's keep it secret that he is ill.
zh: 咱们别把他生病的事说出去。

en: He cannot have been ill.
zh: 他那时候不可能生病。

en: Look at the picture which he painted.
zh: 看看他画的这幅画。

en: The picture painted by him is of great value.
zh: 他画的这幅画很有价值。

en: It's a miracle he wasn't killed in the plane crash.
zh: 他在空难中捡回一条命，真是奇迹。

en: Spectators gathered as he climbed into the plane.
zh: 他上飞机的时候，观众都围了过来。

en: We were all ears when he started to tell us his secret.
zh: 他开始讲秘密的时候，我们都竖起耳朵在听。

en: It was obvious to everybody that he was tired.
zh: 大家都看得出来他累了。

en: It's clear from his actions that he loves her.
zh: 从他的举动能看出来他爱她。

en: There's nothing that can be done about his feeling sorry for her.
zh: 他非要同情她，谁也没办法。

en: That he loved her was certain.
zh: 他爱她是肯定的。

en: No one knows whether he loves her or not.
zh: 没人知道他到底爱不爱她。

en: We couldn't stop him from hitting her.
zh: 我们没能拦住他打她。

en: He told her and she smiled.
zh: 他告诉了她，她笑了。

en: That he is in love with her is true.
zh: 他爱上她了是真的。

en: It's true that he is in love with her.
zh: 确实，他爱上她了。

en: He may well get angry with her.
zh: 他对她发火也是情理之中。

en: It is cruel of him to say such things to her.
zh: 他对她说那种话，真是太残忍了。

en: It was cruel of him to say such things to her.
zh: 他对她说这种话，心也太狠了。

en: It stands to reason that he should apologize to her.
zh: 按理说，他应该跟她道个歉。

en: The day came at last when he had to part from her.
zh: 他不得不跟她分别的那一天终于来了。

en: It is a pity that he can not marry her.
zh: 真可惜，他没法娶她。

en: It's a pity that he can't marry her.
zh: 挺遗憾的，他不能娶她。

en: It's a pity that he can't get married to her.
zh: 他没法跟她结婚，真可惜。

en: There is no question that he will marry her.
zh: 毫无疑问，他肯定会娶她的。

en: I agree to his marrying her.
zh: 我同意他娶她。

en: It was uncertain whether he would marry her.
zh: 当时还不确定他会不会娶她。

en: He or I am to blame.
zh: 不是他就是我有错。

en: He's in charge of the sales department.
zh: 他负责销售部。

en: We thought it natural that he should be punished.
zh: 我们觉得他受罚是理所应当的。

en: He deserves punishment.
zh: 他该罚。

en: We took it for granted that he had been punished.
zh: 我们想当然地以为他已经受过罚了。

en: The first item he bought was an alarm clock.
zh: 他买的第一样东西是个闹钟。

en: It is true that he went bankrupt.
zh: 他确实破产了。

en: I would have taken care of him if I had known that he was ill with a fever.
zh: 要是我早知道他在发烧，我就去照顾他了。

en: There is no hope of his being appointed.
zh: 他被任命是没戏了。

en: I had been reading a book when he came in.
zh: 他进来的时候，我正在看书。

en: I had been reading for an hour when he came in.
zh: 他进来的时候，我已经看了一个小时的书了。

en: I had been studying English for two hours when he came in.
zh: 他进来的时候，我已经学了两个小时英语了。

en: The atmosphere became strained when he came.
zh: 他一来，气氛就变得很紧张。

en: It was dark when he came in.
zh: 他进来的时候，天已经黑了。

en: Did you notice him coming in?
zh: 你注意到他进来了吗？

en: I had been reading a book for about an hour when he came in.
zh: 他进来的时候，我已经看了快一个小时的书了。

en: He came in, and at the same time the bell rang.
zh: 他一进来，铃就响了。

en: The door shut after him.
zh: 门在他身后关上了。

en: It has been ten years since he left Japan.
zh: 他离开日本已经十年了。

en: It has been three months since he left Japan.
zh: 他离开日本已经三个月了。

en: He is a famous physicist not only in Japan, but in the world.
zh: 他不光在日本，在全世界都是著名的物理学家。

en: He's a famous physicist not only in Japan, but throughout the world.
zh: 他不只是在日本出名，全世界都知道他是位物理学家。

en: It has been two years since he came to Japan.
zh: 他来日本已经两年了。

en: He has been in Japan for three years.
zh: 他在日本待了三年了。

en: He came to Japan as a child.
zh: 他小时候就来日本了。

en: He came to Japan when he was a child.
zh: 他是在还是个孩子的时候来日本的。

en: It was when he was a child that he came to Japan.
zh: 他就是在他小时候来日本的。

en: He was seen to go upstairs.
zh: 有人看到他上楼了。

en: His sudden appearance gave rise to trouble.
zh: 他的突然出现引起了不少麻烦。

en: I was surprised at his sudden appearance.
zh: 他的突然出现吓了我一跳。

en: I was surprised by his sudden appearance.
zh: 他的突然出现让我很惊讶。

en: His sudden appearance surprised us all.
zh: 他的突然出现让我们大家都吃了一惊。

en: I don't know at all why he quit his job suddenly.
zh: 我完全不知道他为什么突然辞职。

en: I have no idea why he quit his job suddenly.
zh: 我一点也不清楚他怎么突然就不干了。

en: Let me know why it was that he came suddenly.
zh: 告诉我他到底为什么突然过来。

en: The crowd yelled when he scored a goal.
zh: 他进球的时候，人群欢呼了起来。

en: The results he has got are, in the main, satisfactory.
zh: 他取得的成果基本上还是让人满意的。

en: I saw him cross the street.
zh: 我看到他过马路了。

en: She saw him crossing the road.
zh: 她看见他正过马路呢。

en: It is strange that he should have lost his way.
zh: 真奇怪，他居然会迷路。

en: It was extraordinary that he did not agree.
zh: 真是奇了怪了，他竟然没同意。

en: Where the heck does he work?
zh: 他到底在哪儿上班啊？

en: He may well be proud of his bright son.
zh: 他有个这么聪明的儿子，肯定特别自豪。

en: Let me know when he will arrive.
zh: 他什么时候到告诉我一声。

en: No sooner had he arrived than the bus departed.
zh: 他刚一到，公交车就开了。

en: The train will have started by the time he arrives.
zh: 等他赶到的时候，火车估计早就开了。

en: There was a long interval before he replied.
zh: 过了好久他才回信。

en: There was a long interval before he answered.
zh: 过了好久他才回答。

en: Needless to say he is one of the best writers of the present generation.
zh: 不用说，他是当代最优秀的作家之一。

en: No one went to the station to see him off when he left for Tokyo.
zh: 他走的时候，没人去车站送他。

en: I think it certain that he went to Tokyo.
zh: 我敢肯定他去东京了。

en: I'm sure that he went to Tokyo.
zh: 我肯定他去东京了。

en: On his getting to Tokyo, I'll telephone you.
zh: 他一到东京我就给你打电话。

en: When he arrives in Tokyo, I'll call you right away.
zh: 他一到东京，我就马上给你打个电话。

en: It is half a year since he went to Tokyo.
zh: 他去东京已经半年了。

en: There's no denying his ability as a pitcher, but he is rather injury-prone.
zh: 他当投手的实力没得说，就是特别容易受伤。

en: I caught him by the arm before he could fall.
zh: 在他摔倒之前，我一把抓住了他的胳膊。

en: It's natural for him to get angry.
zh: 他生气也正常。

en: I think it natural for him to get angry.
zh: 我觉得他生气很正常。

en: It is quite natural that he should be angry.
zh: 他发火也是理所应当的。

en: It is rare for him to get angry.
zh: 他很少发脾气。

en: I didn't tell him the truth for fear he would get angry.
zh: 我怕他生气，就没跟他说实话。

en: No wonder he is so angry.
zh: 难怪他发这么大火。

en: I think it natural that he got angry.
zh: 我觉得他发火挺正常的。

en: Naturally he got angry.
zh: 他当然生气了。

en: I was annoyed with him for his interruptions.
zh: 他老是打断我，弄得我很烦。

en: The crowd cheered when he appeared.
zh: 他一露面，人群就欢呼了起来。

en: Ten years have passed since he went to America.
zh: 他去美国已经十年了。

en: We were in the middle of lunch when he gave me a ring.
zh: 他给我打电话的时候，我们正吃午饭呢。

en: I had been reading a book for some time when he called.
zh: 他打来电话的时候，我正看书呢。

en: It is certain that he missed the train.
zh: 他肯定没赶上那趟火车。

en: I saw him enter the store.
zh: 我看见他进店了。

en: That he is a genius is clear to everyone.
zh: 谁都看得出他是个天才。

en: You can easily tell that he is a genius.
zh: 你一眼就能看出来他是个天才。

en: The gun went off while he was cleaning it, and the bullet almost struck his wife.
zh: 他擦枪的时候走火了，子弹差点儿打中他老婆。

en: It was proved that he was a thief.
zh: 事实证明他就是个小偷。

en: I couldn't help laughing when I saw him lying face down covered with mud.
zh: 看到他满身泥巴趴在地上，我忍不住笑了。

en: The errors apparent in his results are due more to carelessness than faulty procedures.
zh: 他的结果出错主要还是因为粗心，倒不是方法有问题。

en: I stepped aside so that he could pass.
zh: 我往旁边让了让，好让他过去。

en: I stepped aside so he could pass.
zh: 我侧身让了下，让他过去。

en: When he was about to pass, the Sphinx jumped in front of him.
zh: 就在他要过去的时候，斯芬克斯突然跳到了他面前。

en: We saw him walk across the street.
zh: 我们看见他过了马路。

en: He was seen crossing the street.
zh: 有人看到他在过马路。

en: He was seen crossing the road.
zh: 有人看见他在横穿马路。

en: We saw him walking across the street.
zh: 我们看到他正过马路呢。

en: It is his laziness that he must overcome.
zh: 他最该克服的就是懒惰。

en: May he live long!
zh: 祝他长寿！

en: It was yesterday that I saw him walking down the street.
zh: 我就是昨天看见他在街上走的。

en: He was brilliant in the morning sun.
zh: 他在清晨的阳光下显得格外耀眼。

en: Hardly had he finished breakfast when the doctor came.
zh: 他刚吃完早饭，医生就来了。

en: Hardly had he finished breakfast when the telephone rang.
zh: 他刚吃完早饭，电话就响了。

en: He intervened and settled the matter peacefully for the time being.
zh: 他出面干预，暂时平息了这件事。

en: I took it for granted that he would become a member.
zh: 我理所当然地认为他会入会。

en: His knowledge of Chinese enables us to carry out our plan smoothly.
zh: 他懂中文，这让我们可以顺利地执行计划。

en: I stepped aside so that he could come in.
zh: 我往旁边让了让，好让他进来。

en: That he grew up in China is well-known.
zh: 他是在中国长大的，这大家都知道。

en: Let's leave as soon as he arrives.
zh: 他一到我们就出发。

en: I'll give him this message the moment he arrives.
zh: 他一到我就把口信传给他。

en: Give him this message the moment he arrives.
zh: 他一到你就把口信传给他。

en: Give him this message as soon as he arrives.
zh: 他一到你就把这个消息告诉他。

en: His delay made the situation all the worse.
zh: 由于他的拖延，情况变得更糟了。

en: I knew that he was trying to use that money to become governor.
zh: 我知道他想用那笔钱去竞选州长。

en: If only he had known!
zh: 要是他早点知道就好了！

en: He run fastest by a long chalk.
zh: 他跑得最快，别人根本没法比。

en: He sent me a birthday card.
zh: 他给我寄了一张生日卡。

en: I don't know who he is.
zh: 我不知道他是谁。

en: After he bumped into the shelf, the priceless china fell and shattered into fragments.
zh: 他撞到架子后，那件昂贵的瓷器掉在地上摔得粉碎。

en: It never occurred to me that he was a prison-breaker.
zh: 我怎么也没想到他竟然是个越狱犯。

en: It never occurred to me that he might be an escaped prisoner.
zh: 我压根儿没想过他可能是个逃犯。

en: Much to his surprise, he found his dog dead.
zh: 让他大吃一惊的是，他发现他的狗死了。

en: To his great joy, his team won the game.
zh: 让他特别高兴的是，他的球队赢了比赛。

en: I really like him!
zh: 我真的挺喜欢他的！

en: I don't know whether he's a college student or not.
zh: 我不知道他是不是大学生。

en: His mother's prophecy that he would be a great musician was later fulfilled.
zh: 他妈妈预言他会成为伟大的音乐家，后来果然成真了。

en: The bigger the words he used, the harder it was to find anything in them.

zh: 我觉得他考试肯定能过。

en: It is certain that he passed the examination.
zh: 他肯定考过了。

en: I'm glad that he passed the exam.
zh: 他考过了我挺开心的。

en: I was pleased to hear that he had succeeded in the examination.
zh: 听说他考过了，我挺高兴的。

en: That he passed the exam is surprising to us.
zh: 他居然考过了，我们挺意外的。

en: It is no wonder that he passed the examination.
zh: 难怪他能考过。

en: It is true that he got full marks on the test.
zh: 他考试确实得了满分。

en: I don't know whether he will agree to our plan or not.
zh: 我不知道他会不会同意我们的计划。

en: It's impossible that he forgot our meeting.
zh: 他不可能忘了我们的见面。

en: We took it for granted that he would join us.
zh: 我们理所当然地觉得他会加入我们。

en: I expected that he would visit me.
zh: 我还以为他会来看我。

en: I began to understand the reason why he hated me.
zh: 我开始明白他为什么讨厌我了。

en: He came to my rescue.
zh: 他来救我了。

en: It has dawned upon me that he does not like me.
zh: 我才反应过来，他其实不喜欢我。

en: I know he is watching me.
zh: 我知道他在盯着我。

en: He has made me what I am.
zh: 是他成就了现在的我。

en: I saw him looking at me.
zh: 我看到他在看我。

en: I was surprised because he lifted me up with ease.
zh: 他轻轻松松就把我拎起来了，吓了我一跳。

en: He chose to have me stay.
zh: 他选了我留下来。

en: I felt like hitting him when he tried to cheat me.
zh: 他想骗我的时候，我真想揍他。

en: It is not likely that he did it on purpose to deceive me.
zh: 他应该不是故意要骗我的。

en: It never occurred to me that he loved me.
zh: 我压根儿没想到他会爱我。

en: He went into the water before me.
zh: 他比我先下水。

en: I don't know whether he's younger or older than I am.
zh: 我不知道他比我大还是比我小。

en: I think it was a mistake that he didn't take my advice.
zh: 我觉得他不听我的建议是个错误。

en: If he had taken my advice, he would now be rich.
zh: 要是他听了我的建议，现在早发财了。

en: It is necessary that he follow my advice.
zh: 他必须得听我的建议。

en: He needs to follow my advice.
zh: 他得听我的建议。

en: He went in place of me.
zh: 他替我去了。

en: I think it doubtful whether he understood my explanation.
zh: 我怀疑他到底有没有听懂我的解释。

en: He's charging me roughly four times as much as he charged when he started cutting my lawn.
zh: 他现在的除草费差不多是他刚开始时的四倍。

en: What he finds in my face I can't guess.
zh: 我猜不出他能从我脸上看出什么。

en: He has my fate in his hands.
zh: 我的命运掌握在他手里。

en: Either he or I have to attend the convention.
zh: 不是他去就是我去参加那个大会。

en: Whether he agrees to my opinion or not, I will do the work.
zh: 不管他同不同意我的意见，这活儿我都干定了。

en: Either he or I am to attend the meeting.
zh: 他或者我，总得有一个人去开会。

en: Either he is to blame, or I am.
zh: 这事儿要么怪他，要么怪我。

en: He is wrong or I am.
zh: 不是他错了就是我错了。

en: Either he is wrong or I am.
zh: 要么是他错了，要么是我错了。

en: He is the chief of my department.
zh: 他是我们部门的老大。

en: What he told me proved true.
zh: 他跟我说的那些话后来都成真的了。

en: I hope he will see me and listen to my future plans.
zh: 我希望他能见见我，听听我未来的计划。

en: I wonder what he promised to do for me.
zh: 我在想他到底答应要帮我做什么。

en: It never occurred to me that he might insist on treating me to dinner.
zh: 我压根没想到他会非要请我吃饭。

en: It is surprising that he should have said such things of me.
zh: 他居然会那样说我，真让人吃惊。

en: If only he would marry me!
zh: 要是他能娶我就好了！

en: That he refused our proposal was big surprise to us.
zh: 他拒绝了我们的提议，让我们大吃一惊。

en: I wish he were on our team.
zh: 要是他在我们队就好了。

en: I don't know whether he'll join us or not.
zh: 我不知道他会不会加入我们。
